body_html:
Hi @georgh yes I did try cast the loss to float16, 32 and 64. Float16 gave the worst result and 32,64 gave same result and it was worse than Keras', in terms of AUC.
And yes I think Keras is using float32 for most of its calculations.
body_text:
Hi @georgh yes I did try cast the loss to float16, 32 and 64. Float16 gave the worst result and 32,64 gave same result and it was worse than Keras', in terms of AUC.
And yes I think Keras is using float32 for most of its calculations.
body:
Hi @georgh yes I did try cast the loss to float16, 32 and 64. Float16 gave the worst result and 32,64 gave same result and it was worse than Keras', in terms of AUC.
And yes I think Keras is using float32 for most of its calculations.
